# Tire Industry Open Technology Foundation, Inc.

**Corporate Charter (Draft)**
*A Delaware Not-for-Profit Corporation (501(c)(6))*

---

## ARTICLE I – NAME

The name of the corporation is **Tire Industry Open Technology Foundation, Inc.** (“**TIOTF**” or the “**Corporation**”).

---

## ARTICLE II – REGISTERED AGENT

The registered agent and registered office of the Corporation in the State of Delaware shall be as stated in the initial Certificate of Incorporation filed with the Delaware Secretary of State, or as later amended by the Board of Directors.

---

## ARTICLE III – PURPOSE

TIOTF is organized and operated as a non-profit business league and trade association within the meaning of Section **501(c)(6)** of the Internal Revenue Code.

Its purposes include, but are not limited to:

* Advancing open, vendor-neutral technology standards, software, and data interoperability for the tire, fleet, and service-provider industries.
* Developing, maintaining, and governing open-source software, including:

  * the flagship open-source enterprise tire service management system,
  * reference architectures,
  * schemas,
  * integration standards,
  * shared digital infrastructure.
* Improving cybersecurity posture and digital resilience across the industry by providing:

  * cybersecurity education and best practices,
  * assessments and readiness programs,
  * threat-intelligence sharing,
  * secure development and operational guidelines.
* Reducing industry fragmentation through shared data models, open APIs, interoperability frameworks, and certification programs.
* Fostering collaboration among tire manufacturers, fleets, service providers, technology companies, and academic or research institutions to improve industry-wide operational excellence and safety.
* Conducting workshops, conferences, training programs, technical committees, and research initiatives for the benefit of the sector.
* Owning and governing a wholly-owned subsidiary corporation, presently envisioned as **Durion Solutions, Inc.**, for the purpose of delivering:

  * commercial support,
  * integration services,
  * cybersecurity services,
  * training,
  * hosting and operationalization of TIOTF technologies.

No part of the Corporation’s net earnings shall inure to the benefit of any private shareholder or individual.

---

## ARTICLE IV – POWERS

The Corporation shall have all powers granted to non-profit corporations under Delaware law, including but not limited to:

* Receiving dues, contributions, sponsorships, and grants.
* Owning, licensing, and enforcing intellectual property, including:

  * open-source licenses (e.g., Apache 2.0),
  * trademarks,
  * certification marks.
* Creating, managing, and dissolving subsidiary entities, including wholly-owned for-profit corporations.
* Establishing committees, councils, and technical working groups.
* Developing and publishing technical specifications, standards, and certifications.
* Contracting with individuals and entities for services or deliverables.

All powers shall be exercised exclusively to further the Corporation’s lawful **501(c)(6)** purpose.

---

## ARTICLE V – MEMBERSHIP
### Section 1 — Membership Classes

TIOTF shall maintain capacity-based membership tiers that are sector-neutral and non-hierarchical in governance.

Membership tiers reflect organizational scale and ability to contribute, not industry segment or influence.

Membership categories may include, but are not limited to:

- Manufacturer Members
- Service Provider Members
- Technology Members
- Fleet / End-User Members
- Individual Contributor Members
- Academic / Research Members (non-voting if designated)
- Government / Regulatory Liaisons (non-voting)

### Section 2 — Membership Tiers and Dues

Membership tiers and dues shall be established and maintained by the Board in a published Membership Policy, and shall:

- Be based on organizational size and capacity
- Apply uniformly across all sectors
- Not convey additional governance rights
- All voting members shall have equal voting rights, regardless of tier.

### Section 3 — Founding and Early Membership Recognition

The Corporation may recognize Founding Members or Early Members based on the timing of their admission.

Such recognition:

- Is honorary and non-governing
- Does not convey additional voting rights
- May include permanent public recognition and advisory participation

### Section 4 — Rights and Obligations

Membership confers the right to:

- Participate in working groups and committees
- Vote as defined in the bylaws
- Access TIOTF standards, specifications, and open-source assets

Membership does not confer:

- Ownership
- Equity
- Profit rights
- Preferential commercial treatment

---

## ARTICLE VI – BOARD OF DIRECTORS

### Section 1 — Temporary Governance Prior to Membership Threshold

Until the Corporation reaches **ten (10)** paying members, TIOTF may operate under an **Interim Governing Committee**, appointed by the Incorporators.
The full Board will be seated only after membership thresholds are reached.

### Section 2 — Composition After Activation

Upon activation, the Board shall be composed of **8–16 Directors**, allocated as follows:

* 25% Manufacturer Representatives
* 25% Service Provider Representatives
* 25% Fleet or End-User Representatives
* 25% Technology Representatives

No single organization may hold more than one seat unless expressly allowed by the bylaws.

### Section 3 — Duties

The Board shall:

* Oversee strategic direction and financial stewardship.
* Ensure openness, neutrality, and broad industry benefit.
* Govern the open-source program and technical direction through delegation to committees.
* Oversee cybersecurity standards, threat-intelligence programs, and certification frameworks.
* Appoint and oversee officers and the Executive Director.
* Maintain control and mission alignment of any subsidiary, including **Durion Solutions**.

### Section 4 — Voting Requirements

* Majority vote for normal business.
* Two-thirds vote for:

  * amendments,
  * licensing policy changes,
  * charter updates,
  * intellectual property governance matters.

---

## ARTICLE VII – OFFICERS

TIOTF shall have at minimum:

* Executive Director
* Treasurer
* Secretary
* Chief Security Officer (or Director of Cybersecurity)

Additional officers may be required by the bylaws.

Officers shall be appointed by and accountable to the Board.

---

## ARTICLE VIII – WORKING GROUPS AND COUNCILS

The Corporation shall maintain standing committees, including:

* Technical Steering Committee (TSC)
* Cybersecurity & Trust Council
* Data Standards & Interoperability Council
* Certification & Compliance Committee
* User & Ecosystem Advisory Council
* Ethics & Governance Committee

Committees may create sub-groups as needed.

---

## ARTICLE IX – INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY & LICENSING

TIOTF shall:

* Maintain open-source projects under a Board-approved OSI license (default: **Apache 2.0**).
* Require Contributor License Agreements (CLAs) or equivalent.
* Retain ownership of TIOTF trademarks, branding, and certification marks.
* Administer a vendor-neutral certification program validating compatibility with TIOTF standards.
* License software, specifications, and documentation on a royalty-free basis consistent with its mission.

---

## ARTICLE X – RELATIONSHIP WITH DURION SOLUTIONS

TIOTF may form and wholly own a for-profit subsidiary known as **Durion Solutions, Inc.**, or similar.

The subsidiary shall provide:

* technical support,
* integration, customization, and hosting,
* cybersecurity services,
* training and certification services.

All profits of the subsidiary shall flow back to TIOTF or be reinvested in furthering TIOTF’s mission.

The Board shall retain full governance control, including appointment of subsidiary directors.

---

## ARTICLE XI – ANTITRUST & COMPETITION COMPLIANCE

TIOTF shall operate in full compliance with U.S. antitrust law.

Accordingly:

* No TIOTF activity may be used to restrain trade or reduce competition.
* Members shall not discuss pricing, market allocation, or competitively sensitive information except where expressly permitted under law.
* TIOTF standards and certifications shall be open, voluntary, and nondiscriminatory.
* Participation in TIOTF shall not restrict a member’s ability to innovate, commercialize, or compete.

TIOTF shall adopt an **Antitrust Policy** incorporated into its bylaws.

---

## ARTICLE XII – LIMITATIONS

The Corporation shall not:

* Attempt to influence legislation except as permitted under Section 501(c)(6).
* Participate in or intervene in any political campaign on behalf of any candidate.
* Permit earnings to benefit private individuals or shareholders.

---

## ARTICLE XIII – DISSOLUTION

Upon dissolution:

* Assets shall be distributed to another **501(c)(6)** or **501(c)(3)** organization with purposes similar to TIOTF.
* No assets may be distributed to any individual, shareholder, or for-profit enterprise.

---

## ARTICLE XIV – AMENDMENTS

This Charter may be amended by:

* A **two-thirds vote** of the seated Board of Directors,
* Followed by any member ratification requirements specified in the bylaws.
